com.flir.flironesdk

Class EmbeddedDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flir.flironesdk.Device
      • com.flir.flironesdk.EmbeddedDevice
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class EmbeddedDevice
extends Device
    Represents an embedded FLIR camera

        public void startFrameStream(Device.StreamDelegate delegate)
        Description copied from class: Device
        Call this method after onDeviceConnected has been called on the device delegate to start frame streaming. This method will have no effect if called before the device is ready

        public void close()
        Description copied from class: Device
        This method disconnects the device. Note that Device.stopDiscovery() will automatically close the device for you, so it is usually not necessary to call this method directly.

      • setAutomaticTuning

        public void setAutomaticTuning(boolean shouldAutomaticallyTune)
        Description copied from class: Device
        Disable or enable the automatic tuning feature of the device. The device defaults to automatic tuning being enabled.
        Specified by:
        setAutomaticTuning in class Device
        Parameters:
        shouldAutomaticallyTune - Set to false to keep the automatic tuning function from being performed. Set to true to re-enable.

      • performTuning

        Description copied from class: Device

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • hasTorch

        public boolean hasTorch()
        Description copied from class: Device
        Indicates whether the device has a torch (flashlight) control. If false, use whatever flashlight is available to the host, for example the Android Camera APIs. If true, the device either has its own torch or controls access to the host torch.
        Overrides:
        hasTorch in class Device
        Returns:
        the presence of a flashlight AKA torch.

      • setTorchMode

        public void setTorchMode(boolean enabled)
        Description copied from class: Device
        If hasTorch returns true, this method will toggle the torch, AKA flashlight.
        Overrides:
        setTorchMode in class Device
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if the torch should be turned on, false if it should be turned off.

      • getUpperAccuracyBound

        public float getUpperAccuracyBound()
        Description copied from class: Device
        Gets the device's upper bound for temperature accuracy in Kelvin, temperature values seen above this value have undefined accuracy.
        Overrides:
        getUpperAccuracyBound in class Device
        Returns:
        the maximum kelvin reading that can is within the accuracy spec for the device
